title: Enable pop-up for site with multiple pages/servers - wildcards or regex?
content:
I've found a number of sites that have numerous pages or servers that I can't enable the pop-up to work properly.

For example the site will have:

https://www5.site.com https://www.site.com https://www3.site.com

I can't tell which site will be pushing the pop-up so setting the above into the "enable pop-up" still doesn't allow the pop-up to happen.

I don't want to blanket enable all sites but rather use a regex or some wildcards to allow *.site.com to push pop-ups.

I've tried to use wildcards but the dialog box gives an error that I've entered an invalid website address.

How can I use wildcards to allow pop-ups from websites with multiple pages?

Thanks.
creator: pneukom

title: Black or partially black window after minimize/restore with AutoHotkey
content:
Hi, this is my first time asking for help :-)

I use an AutoHotkey script to activate the Firefox window with a keyboard shortcut, e.g. Win+W, to avoid having to cycle through all the windows with alt-tab. Here's the script:

  1. w::

WinActivate ahk_exe C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe Return

It works great when I just switch from any window/app to Firefox. However, when I minimize Firefox, for example to show the desktop with Win+D, then I restore/activate Firefox with my Win+W hotkey, the Firefox window appears entirely black (even the chrome area) or 3/4 black.

By 3/4, I mean that if you divide the window in 4 quadrants, only the first (top left) quadrant is automatically redrawn. The remaining 3 are black.

Sometimes it takes a few seconds before it repaints itself, it's just very slow. Other times, I have to move the mouse over the "chrome" area. Moving the mouse over the content has no effect. Sometimes I press ALT or WIN key twice to make it repaint itself.

At first, I considered this bug a minor issue and thought it would get fixed soon, but after several months, maybe more than a year, I got tired of it. So, I begin by asking here.

To avoid wasting time, I'm not a novice user. I've used Firefox/Mozilla/Netscape for 20+ years. I've tried a new, clean profile without extensions or customization. I've got the latest NVIDIA driver. I've tried disabling HW acceleration. Several versions of Firefox are affected. Release and Developer Edition branches. Other apps/browsers are not.

This issue isn't with AutoHotkey since I've tried another hotkey tool with the same result. And I've already asked on their forum.

I believe this simply exposed a hidden bug in Firefox. Painting is not triggered in some cases. I really hope someone here can reproduce this. I'm not ready to file a bug on Bugzilla yet.

My OS is Windows 10 Pro x64, 21H1 (19043.1288), but of course I had an earlier version when the issue began. Same for Firefox, currently 94.0.1 but this problem isn't new. My HW is Intel i5/8GB/GeForce GTX 760.

The red rectangle in the screenshot has been added by me for privacy. The black color is really how it looks.
creator: hixevi8659
